column5: in some areas people are being advised to head to the basement as tornadoes are occurring (from 680news)) or likely to occur..  Please check you're local weather forecast or click this link below for more info..  http://www.weatheroffice.gc.ca/warnings/son_e.html   G
And watch out for huge deep puddles on the road Ive come across five cars tonight stalled out because they went to fast through to deep water
With the summer that we've been having, maybe we should just pin this one Gerritt.
It got really nasty really fast here in Kitchener. It was cloudy all day and all of a sudden the sky just turned black and start thundering and rain started coming down like crazy. Stay safe people
Anyone getting skunked due to the crummy weather turning off the bite?  Are people staying home instead?
I will let this picture do the talking...Fish On!    G
Be safe all  I like this song during these times.

From Environment Canada...  City of Hamilton 9:42 PM EDT Tuesday 22 July 2008 Severe thunderstorm warning for City of Hamilton continued  Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Watch for updated statements. Please refer to the latest public forecasts for further details and continue to monitor the situation through your local radio and television stations or Weatheradio.  Getting prepared to hit the basement just incase...  G

actually there was a tornado or what they call straight line winds monday afternoon in view lake, with is just east of ceasarea on lake scugog, and during the storm hyfro poles that have been there for over 50 years were ripped out of the ground and the sparks etc. created a small forest fire  I know this since my brother in law is a firefighter up there and responded to the call and fire
I went out this morning after the rain stopped. They weren't jumping in the boat but the neighbours kids did okay...
drove form oakville to chatham this evening and wow it was intense, for brantford west to london it was wild for a while.  white knuckle driving for sure  Cheers!
WOW, i reeally gotta check the weather before i head out. today i went to a local pond for some LMB fishing, saw some lightning far off in the west, but got rained on a little only
Crap. Natalie's is bigger'n any of mine.  JF
